questions.q: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.e: The Nile River, flowing through northeastern Africa, is considered the longest river at 6,650 km.

questions.q: Which is the smallest country in the world by area?
questions.e: Vatican City, an independent city-state within Rome, Italy, is the smallest country with an area of just 44 hectares.

questions.q: What is the primary cause of ocean currents?
questions.e: Ocean currents are primarily driven by wind, which transfers energy to the water's surface.

questions.q: What is the primary component of Earth's core?
questions.e: The Earth's core is composed mainly of iron and nickel, making it dense and metallic.

questions.q: Which is the deepest point in the Earth's oceans?
questions.e: The Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean is the deepest, reaching nearly 11 km below sea level.
